00002  * @brief   Binary tree implementation.
00003  *
00004  * Methods for working with Arrow's binary tree data structure.
00005  *
00006  * @author  John LaRusic

00008  ****************************************************************************/
00009 #include "arrow.h"

00011 /****************************************************************************
00012  * Private function prototypes
00013  ****************************************************************************/
00014 /**
00015  *  @brief  Constructs a new node structure with the given value.
00016  *  @param  node [out] pointer to node structure
00017  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00018  */
00019 int
00020 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value);
00021 
00022 /**
00023  *  @brief  Frees the memory of the given node and its child nodes.
00024  *  @param  node [out] node structure
00025  */
00026 void
00027 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node);
00028 
00029 /**
00030  *  @brief  Inserts a given value into the tree at the given node, or one of
00031  *          its child nodes.
00032  *  @param  tree [in] pointer to tree structure
00033  *  @param  node [out] pointer to node structure
00034  *  @param  value [in] value to assign to new node
00035  */
00036 int
00037 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value);
00038 
00039 /**
00040  *  @brief  Recursive helper function to fill an array in nondecreasing order.
00041  *  @param  node [out] pointer to an node structure
00042  *  @param  array [out] pointer to array to fill
00043  *  @param  pos [out] current position in array
00044  */
00045 void
00046 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int **array, int *pos);

00049 /****************************************************************************
00050  * Public function implemenations
00051  ****************************************************************************/
00052 void
00053 arrow_bintree_init(arrow_bintree *tree)
00054 {
00055     tree->size = 0;
00056     tree->root_node = NULL;
00057 }
00058 
00059 void
00060 arrow_bintree_destruct(arrow_bintree *tree)
00061 {
00062     if(tree->size > 0)
00063         destruct_node(tree->root_node);
00064 }
00065 
00066 int
00067 arrow_bintree_insert(arrow_bintree *tree, int value)
00068 { 
00069     int ret;
00070 
00071     if(tree->size == 0)
00072     {
00073         arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00074         ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00075         tree->root_node = new_node;
00076         tree->size++;
00077     }
00078     else
00079     {
00080         ret = insert_at(tree, tree->root_node, value);
00081     }
00082 
00083     return ret;
00084 }
00085 
00086 int
00087 arrow_bintree_to_array(arrow_bintree *tree, int **array)
00088 {
00089     int ret, pos;
00090     
00091     ret = arrow_util_create_int_array(tree->size, array);
00092     if(ret == ARROW_SUCCESS)
00093     {
00094         pos = 0;
00095         fill_array(tree->root_node, array, &pos);
00096     }
00097     return ret;
00098 }
00099 
00100 
00101 /****************************************************************************
00102  * Private function implemenations
00103  ****************************************************************************/
00104 int
00105 construct_node(arrow_bintree_node **node, int value)
00106 {
00107     if((*node = malloc(sizeof(arrow_bintree_node))) == NULL)
00108     {
00109         arrow_print_error("Error allocating memory for arrow_bintree_node.");
00110         node = NULL;
00111         return ARROW_ERROR_FATAL;
00112     }
00113     
00114     (*node)->data = value;
00115     (*node)->has_left_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00116     (*node)->has_right_node = ARROW_FALSE;
00117     (*node)->left_node = NULL;
00118     (*node)->right_node = NULL;
00119     
00120     return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00121 }
00122 
00123 void
00124 destruct_node(arrow_bintree_node *node)
00125 {
00126     if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00127     {
00128         destruct_node(node->left_node);
00129         free(node->left_node);
00130         node->left_node = NULL;
00131     }
00132     if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_TRUE)
00133     {
00134         destruct_node(node->right_node);
00135         free(node->right_node);
00136         node->right_node = NULL;
00137     }
00138 }
00139 
00140 int
00141 insert_at(arrow_bintree *tree, arrow_bintree_node *node, int value)
00142 {
00143     int ret;
00144     arrow_bintree_node *new_node;
00145     
00146     /* Check for duplicate value */
00147     if(node->data == value)
00148     {
00149         return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00150     }
00151     /* Insert to the left of this node */
00152     else if(node->data > value)
00153     {
00154         if(node->has_left_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00155         {
00156             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00157             if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00158                 return ret;
00159             node->left_node = new_node;
00160             node->has_left_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00161             tree->size++;
00162             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00163         }
00164         else
00165         {
00166             return insert_at(tree, node->left_node, value);
00167         }
00168     }
00169     /* Insert to the right of this node */
00170     else
00171     {
00172         if(node->has_right_node == ARROW_FALSE)
00173         {
00174             ret = construct_node(&new_node, value);
00175             if(ret == ARROW_ERROR_FATAL)
00176                 return ret;
00177             node->right_node = new_node;
00178             node->has_right_node = ARROW_TRUE;
00179             tree->size++;
00180             return ARROW_SUCCESS;
00181         }
00182         else
00183         {
00184             return insert_at(tree, node->right_node, value);
00185         }
00186     }
00187 }
00188 
00189 void
00190 fill_array(arrow_bintree_node *node, int **array, int *pos)
00191 {
00192     if(node->has_left_node)
00193         fill_array(node->left_node, array, pos);
00194     (*array)[*pos] = node->data;
00195     (*pos)++;
00196     if(node->has_right_node)
00197         fill_array(node->right_node, array, pos);
00198 }
